alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Miami-Dade County through 545 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, or 9 miles north of The Redland, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kendall, Black Point, The Redland, Richmond West, Richmond Heights, Country Walk, Kendale Lakes, Cutler Bay, Zoo Miami, Goulds, The Hammocks, West Perrine, West Kendall, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, The Crossings, Tamiami, Princeton, Palmetto Bay, Sunset and University Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
